When writing proposals, you:
- Create detailed, specific content based on the provided project information
- Use industry-specific terminology and best practices
- Include concrete examples, methodologies, and deliverables
- Write persuasive, benefit-focused content
- Structure content with clear headings and professional formatting
- Avoid generic placeholder text like "Feature 1" or "Benefit 1"

Please provide detailed, specific content based on the information provided - do not use generic placeholder text.

CLIENT INFORMATION:
- Client Name: ${proposal.clientName}
- Project Description: ${proposal.description}
- Budget Range: ${proposal.budget||'To be determined'}
- Timeline: ${proposal.timeline||'To be determined'}

PROJECT DETAILS:
${proposal.description}

Please create a detailed proposal with the following sections. For each section, provide specific, actionable content based on the project description:

1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
   - Provide a compelling overview of the project
   - Highlight key benefits and value proposition
   - Include specific outcomes and ROI expectations

2. PROJECT OVERVIEW
   - Detailed analysis of the project requirements
   - Industry context and challenges
   - Specific objectives and success criteria

3. OUR APPROACH & METHODOLOGY
   - Detailed step-by-step methodology
   - Specific tools, technologies, and processes
   - Quality assurance and testing procedures
   - Risk management strategies

4. DETAILED SCOPE OF WORK
   - Comprehensive list of deliverables
   - Specific tasks and activities
   - Technical specifications and requirements
   - Integration and deployment processes

5. TIMELINE & MILESTONES
   - Detailed project timeline with specific dates
   - Key milestones and deliverables
   - Dependencies and critical path
   - Progress tracking and reporting schedule

6. INVESTMENT & PRICING
   - Detailed cost breakdown
   - Payment terms and schedule
   - Value proposition and ROI analysis
   - Optional add-ons and future considerations

7. WHY CHOOSE US
   - Relevant experience and expertise
   - Team qualifications and certifications
   - Success stories and case studies
   - Competitive advantages

8. NEXT STEPS
   - Clear action items and timeline
   - Decision-making process
   - Contact information and availability

IMPORTANT: Make each section detailed and specific to this project. Do not use generic text like "Feature 1" or "Benefit 1".
